result.execSummary:
All charges against Donald W Pitman in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald W Pitman is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald W Pitman

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM Defendant Donald W Pitman appeared via Attorney Krueger Smith's telephone.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Donald W Pitman.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. The State does not have an objection to Mr. Pitman appearing via phone. The State moves to dismiss the matter due to no Governors warrant at this time. Defense does not object. The Court orders Cash bond to be returned to the posting party. Matter dismissed.

3:32 PM Defendant Donald W Pitman in court.  Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court for Donald W Pitman.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Nolen states they are stilling waiting on the governors warrant and requests an extension of 60 days. Matter extended. Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Review hearing on July 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Clerk emailed CBS to court info

Violation: Extradition
Issuing Agency: Albany PD

1:14 PM Defendant Donald W Pitman in court, In custody.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jane Krueger-Smith appeared in court for bond purposes. Court advises defendant of rights.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties. Defendant wishes to contest extradition. State requests a $15,000 cash bond. Attorney Krueger- Smith argues bond. Court directs a $2,500 cash bail.  Defendant is asking for a governors warrant.
Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
